p: Interestingly, coumarin metal complexes also show antibacterial activity. Such is the case of 3-arylcoumarins that present general structures X ( Figure 3), coordinated with Re( I), active against MRSA in nanomolar concentrations [ 22]; or the complexes of general structure XI, a coordination of coumarinâ€“quinoline hybrids with Cu( I), with activity against Flavobacterium psychrophilum, a Gram-negative bacterium that causes significant septicemia in fish, causing devastating economic problems in aquaculture [ 23].
